thread.title: Carrie Fisher’s half-sister gives an update on Gary Fisher, and he looks like he’s doing okay!
thread.title_full: Carrie Fisher’s half-sister gives an update on Gary Fisher, and he looks like he’s doing okay!

author: Allanah Dykes
title: Carrie Fisher’s half-sister gives an update on Gary Fisher, and he looks like he’s doing okay!
text:
Carrie Fisher’s half-sister gives an update on Gary Fisher, and he looks like he’s doing okay! When Carrie Fisher passed away she left behind her registered therapy dog. Many of her fans and followers have wondered what happened to the French bulldog, but Carrie Fisher’s half sister gave us all an update on Twitter and the dog is doing as well as he could be!
Joely Fisher took to Twitter to let all of the beautiful dog’s fans know that he is happy and well cared for .
“Auntie Joely got to hang w/ @realgaryfisher today…he is happy and well cared for. He sends big love 2 all his fans @carrieffisher.” Before Carrie Fisher passed away, the dog had already amassed a huge following on social media. With over 120,000 followers on Instagram, and a newly created Twitter page (originally there was a fan account with almost 5,000 followers but it has been deleted) the account has become a comfort for grieving fans. The Instagram bio on the now verified account reads, “I’m the real Gary Fisher, I miss my mom more than ever and here I am to show you # garyloveshismom.”
Auntie Joely got to hang w/ @realgaryfisher today...he is happy and well cared for. He sends big love 2 all his fans @carrieffisher pic.twitter.com/wUWpI7YkAo 
— Joely Fisher (@MsJoelyFisher) January 10, 2017 Cue hearts breaking all over the world! It is unclear who is behind the social media accounts, but it features pictures of Gary and tributes to the late Carrie Fisher.
I want to thank all my fans who are my family for all the support, I love and miss my mom and grandma more than ever. Thank you for acknowledging who they both were and will always be. She loved everyone. ❤️ #garyloveshismom #garyloveshisfans #garyfisher #carriefisher #garymisseshismom 
A photo posted by Gary Fisher (@garyfisher) on Jan 1, 2017 at 5:17pm PST 
The fan-favorite service dog accompanied Fisher everywhere and helped the star with her bipolar disorder.
Thanks everyone for all the follows, I love my mom and my FANS ❤ #garyloveshismom #garyloveshisfans #garyinbelgium2016 #garytravelstheworld #garyfisher 
A photo posted by Gary Fisher (@garyfisher) on Dec 22, 2016 at 1:20am PST 
Our heart goes out to the Fisher family and we are so glad the service dog is coping without his beloved mother!
